title: (x) Universal Private Asset Management Inc. - Eurostile Ext/Microgramma {Carl}
content:
CAN ANYONE HELP ME PLEASE!!

Hello Im new to this site and i really find it Very Helpful. can anyone tell me what font was used in this logo

[http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v103/heavystrato/fontfind.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20090924021641/http:/img.photobucket.com/albums/v103/heavystrato/fontfind.jpg "http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v103/heavystrato/fontfind.jpg")
author: edua

comments.content:
Sure, I can help. No need to yell.

That’s Eurostile Bold Extended (sometimes aka Microgramma).

The difference between Microgramma (designed 1952 by [Alessandro Butti](http://web.archive.org/web/20090924021641/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Alessandro%252BButti) and [Aldo Novarese](http://web.archive.org/web/20090924021641/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Aldo%252BNovarese) for [Nebiolo](http://web.archive.org/web/20090924021641/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Nebiolo)) and Eurostile (designed 1962 by Aldo Novarese) is not only 10 years, but that Microgramma was _originally_ a CAPS ONLY face.

I had the pleasure of meeting Signore Novarese (pr. No-vah-reh-zay) and afterwards kept correspondence for a while.

———————————————————————————————-  
Sì, sono vecchio, ma sono indietro nello stile!
